title: 106_hr2180
content: The Act may be cited as the "COLA Fairness Act of 1999" and includes a provision for a Regional Consumer Price Index. The Bureau of Labor Statistics will establish 14 regions in the United States, each including a specified city. These cities include Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Cleveland, Dallas, Detroit, Philadelphia, Houston, Los Angeles, Miami, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, and Washington D.C. The Bureau will also establish Regional Consumer Price Indices. The Bureau of Labor Statistics will establish Regional Consumer Price Indices for 14 regions in the United States, indicating changes in consumption expenditures typical for residents. The provisions of this section will apply to calendar months starting from January 1, 2001, with necessary appropriations authorized for implementation. SEC. 3. COMPUTATION OF SOCIAL SECURITY COST-OF-LIVING INCREASES. Amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act regarding the computation of cost-of-living increases. Amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act include changes to the computation of cost-of-living increases, such as adjusting the applicable Consumer Price Index based on the region where the individual resides. The amendments made by this section have a specified effective date. The amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act, including changes to cost-of-living computation, will apply to determinations made by the Commissioner of Social Security for quarters ending on or after September 30 of the second calendar year following the enactment of this Act. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act are being made. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act include adjustments to the cap amount for accounting years based on changes in the medical care expenditure category of the consumer price index. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve updating references to the consumer price index in various sections to reflect changes in the medical care expenditure category. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve updating references to the consumer price index in various sections to reflect changes in the medical care expenditure category. The amendments include replacing the "consumer price index for all urban consumers" with the "applicable consumer price index" in multiple sections of the Act. Additionally, a definition for the "applicable consumer price index" is added to Section 1861 of the Act. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve updating references to the consumer price index in various sections. Such Act (42 U.S.C. 1395x) is amended by adding a new subsection at the end. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve updating references to the consumer price index in various sections, including the Applicable Consumer Price Index. The term 'applicable consumer price index' refers to the Regional Consumer Price Index determined by the Bureau of Labor Statistics. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will regulate adjustments based on this index for individuals or entities affected. The amendments apply to determinations for periods ending after a specified date. The amendments apply to determinations made for periods ending after December 31 of the second calendar year following the enactment of this Act.
